description: From Middle French rheumatique, from Latin rheumaticus, from Ancient Greek ῥευματικός (rheumatikós), from ῥεῦμα (rheûma, “stream, flow”) from ῥέω (rhéō, “I flow”).

adjectives.description: rheumatic (comparative more rheumatic, superlative most rheumatic)

entries.meaning: Derived from, or having the character of, rheum; rheumic.

examples: It has been a clinical observation with me that the majority of chronic rheumatics are likewise the subjects of chronic constipation.
